revised_title: Applying Control Theory to Economic Models: Enhancing Predictability and Policy Credibility
tldr: This article discusses the application of control theory to macroeconomic models, focusing on enhancing predictability and policy credibility. The authors explore how control theory can help in setting up economic models, taking action to control the economy, and improving the quality of predictions. They also highlight the importance of considering unexpected disturbances and the role of feedback control in maintaining policy credibility.
